children.subject: If you're working full time on research over the summer then you'll almost definitely get paid; when it comes to the semester, it's a little more case-by-case. That being said, your best bet is to actually talk to the people you'll be possibly researching with. If getting paid is important, then make sure they know that and ask them if they plan on paying the researcher so you're either on the same page or know that you're not a good fit

history.content: I want to do research next summer under PhD/postdoc or professor and wish to get paid given I'm not doing a SWE internship. Is there a way to get paid next summer? Besides, how can I get paid while doing research during the semesters?
history.subject: how to get paid as a undergrad researcher?
